sentences.english: The bleak frost packed and paved the square as with some ringing metal.
sentences.chinese: 慘白的霜凍牢固地鋪在廣場上，象是鏗鏘發響的金屬。

sentences.english: The metal tool clanged when it hit the ground.
sentences.chinese: 金屬工具碰撞到地面時，便發出鏗鏘聲。

sentences.english: Which makes them at the beginning of the Tiger issued a sonorous voice of the turn.
sentences.chinese: 這使得他們在虎年伊始發出了鏗鏘有力的轉折之聲。

sentences.english: Her singing sometimes sonorous, powerful, sometimes soft lyrical.
sentences.chinese: 她的演唱時而鏗鏘有力，時而柔美抒情。

sentences.english: Dishes and plates were clattering in the dining car.
sentences.chinese: 盤碟在餐車中鏗鏘作響。

sentences.english: The clatter of metal plates was heard from the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 廚房傳出金屬盤子的鏗鏘聲。

sentences.english: Their fans call them Steel Roses .
sentences.chinese: 她們的球迷把她們叫做鏗鏘玫瑰。

sentences.english: Jensen’s words and ideas are powerful.
sentences.chinese: 詹森的話語和想法鏗鏘有力。

sentences.english: In China, the progress of the energetic and strong is such.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，前進的步伐就是如此鏗鏘和有力。

sentences.english: People like to listen to Leos because they sound strong and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 人們喜歡聽從獅子座的人，因爲他們聽起來鏗鏘有力。

sentences.english: Goes to the barbarous clangour of a gong.
sentences.chinese: 踩踏着一面銅鑼的野蠻的鏗鏘節拍。

sentences.english: Bright to manner of this not little officer one's words clang.
sentences.chinese: 對此不少官員態度鮮明言詞鏗鏘。

sentences.english: Their fans call them the Steel Roses.
sentences.chinese: 他們的球迷稱他們爲鏗鏘玫瑰。

sentences.english: Their fans call them The Steel Roses .
sentences.chinese: 她們的球迷把她們叫做鏗鏘玫瑰。

sentences.english: Does Clang promote shorts to integers when combined with number literals on ARM targets?
sentences.chinese: 做鏗鏘促進短褲加上數字面值整數ARM目標？

sentences.english: The elegance of the ancient music condenses into the deep national complex;
sentences.chinese: 詩文古樂的馨雅緻韻，凝結成鏗鏘悠遠的民族情節。

definition: music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
a transition (stop and change) in spoken sound, music or in brush strokes/a cadence/punctuated by a transition/with syncopated cadence (brush stroke in painting)
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
to chat with a low voice
to do something at one go/to flow smoothly
simple and honest/unsophisticated/(music etc) deep and resounding
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
